Written by Viveat Susan Pinto July 9, 2025 21:24 IST Follow Us Asian Paints Exits AkzoNobel India for Rs 734 Crore as JSW Paints Eyes Control. (Image Source: Reuters) Asian Paints , the countrys largest paint maker, on Wednesday, sold its entire 4.42% shareholding in AkzoNobel India for Rs 734 crore. The transaction comes close on the heels of rival JSW Paints announcing that it was acquiring a 74.76% stake in AkzoNobel India. The transaction was executed via a bulk deal at a floor price of Rs 3,651 per share, data from NSE shows. Shares of AkzoNobel India closed trade down 1.6% at Rs 3,627 apiece on Wednesday on the NSE. Two million shares exchanged hands in the bulk deal. Buyers included EastSpring Investments India and ICICI Prudential Mutual Fund, who bought 0.25 million and 0.7 million shares each, data from the stock exchange shows. Written by Viveat Susan Pinto July 9, 2025 21:24 IST Follow Us Asian Paints Exits AkzoNobel India for Rs 734 Crore as JSW Paints Eyes Control. (Image Source: Reuters) Asian Paints , the countrys largest paint maker, on Wednesday, sold its entire 4.42% shareholding in AkzoNobel India for Rs 734 crore. The transaction comes close on the heels of rival JSW Paints announcing that it was acquiring a 74.76% stake in AkzoNobel India. The transaction was executed via a bulk deal at a floor price of Rs 3,651 per share, data from NSE shows. Shares of AkzoNobel India closed trade down 1.6% at Rs 3,627 apiece on Wednesday on the NSE. Two million shares exchanged hands in the bulk deal. Buyers included EastSpring Investments India and ICICI Prudential Mutual Fund, who bought 0.25 million and 0.7 million shares each, data from the stock exchange shows. JSW Paints has said that it is keen to get into the third position in three years by expanding its manufacturing and distribution. Asian Paints has said that the competitive flux will remain in the sector for the next few years amid the fight to get bigger among players. Kansai Nerolac: Exhibits solid performance, particularly in the industrial coatings space, with significant growth rates in revenue and a focused approach on specific sectors like automotive coatings, which contributes notably to its financials. The growth was notably strong in both the decorative and industrial coatings segments, with a combined value growth of 6.1%. Business News Kansai Nerolac Paints Ltd Announces Q4 2024 Results FY 2024-20 Uploaded On May 7, 2025 by Team Konexio Mumbai : Kansai Nerolac Paints Limited (KNPL), one of the leading Paint companies in India, today at the Board meeting announced its audited results for the fourth quarter of the financial year 2024-25. For the quarter, the company declared Net revenue of Rs. 1740.4 Crores, a growth of 4.7 % over the corresponding quarter of the previous year. EBIDTA was at Rs. 177.8 Crores, a de-growth of 0.7 % over the same quarter of the previous year. PBT before exception items was at Rs 163.8 Crores, a growth of 1.0 % over the same quarter of the previous year. For the year, net revenue was Rs. 7496.7 Crores, growth of 1.4 % over the same period of the previous year. EBIDTA was at Rs. 974.1 Crores, a de-growth of 4.8% over the same period of the previous year. PBT before exceptional items were at Rs. 907.4 Crores, a de-growth of 1.7 % over the same period of the previous year. The Board has recommended a total dividend of 375 % ( 3.75 per share) including special dividend of 125% ( 1.25 per share) for the financial year ended March 31, 2025, as compared to total dividend of 375 % ( 3.75 per share) last year. Commenting on the results, Mr. Pravin Chaudhari, Managing Director, Kansai Nerolac Paints Ltd said, During the quarter, In Decorative, the growth of Paint+, Construction Chemicals, Wood finishes and Projects continued to do well. There is a gradual recovery seen in overall demand for Decorative as compared to the previous quarter, though the category continued to see tight liquidity and lower spending on discretionary items. The demand for Automotive continued to be better than the market, based on various initiatives. Performance Coatings also continued to register strong growth on the basis of a strong order pipeline. The various initiatives launched by the company over the past 3 years continue to yield results for the company. During the quarter, raw material cost was benign, however forex continued to be volatile. Going forward, the forecast of a good monsoon should augur well for paint industry. Outlook of Indian Paint Industry: The size of domestic paint industry is estimated at around Rs. 75000 crores as of March 2024. The good growth in infrastructure, core sector as well as automobile and real estate is likely to have a positive effect on the overall demand of paint for the industry in the long run. The company operates in both decorative and industrial segments with a wide array of offerings, including emulsion paints, construction chemicals, and wood coatings. Berger Paints has a strong presence not only in India but also in international markets through its subsidiaries and joint ventures. The company is known for innovation, sustainability, and consistent financial performance. Policy About us Services Kansai Nerolac Paints Limited (KNPL): Detailed Analysis marketinsiders.in Oct 4, 2024 Oct 4, 2024 Kansai Nerolac Paints Limited (KNPL) has cemented its position as one of the leading players in the Indian paint industry. As a subsidiary of the Japan-based Kansai Paint Company Ltd., KNPL benefits from global expertise while catering to the diverse and rapidly growing Indian market. The company offers a wide range of products, serving both the decorative and industrial segments with equal proficiency. As of FY24, KNPL boasts an annual production capacity of 61 crore liters, with a strategic plan to scale up to approximately 70 crore liters by FY25. This growth trajectory is driven by the ongoing construction of a new manufacturing facility in Vishakhapatnam. Once completed, this unit will significantly boost the companys overall production capacity and help meet the rising demand across its various product categories. The companys distribution network is extensive, with a strong presence in tier-2, tier-3, and rural areas, which collectively contribute to a significant portion of its revenue. However, KNPL is also keenly focused on expanding its footprint in tier-1 cities, where it sees substantial growth potential. Currently, approximately 55% of the companys revenue is generated from the decorative segment, while the industrial segment contributes the remaining 45%. Within the industrial segment, the automotive industry is a key driver, accounting for over 70% of revenues. Over the years, KNPL has diversified its offerings to include adhesives, construction chemicals, and waterproofing membranes. This diversification is not limited to product lines; the company has also expanded geographically. Today, it operates subsidiaries in Sri Lanka, Nepal, and Bangladesh, enhancing its market position in South Asia. With a robust clientele that includes major automotive manufacturers like Maruti Suzuki, Toyota Kirloskar, Tata Motors, and Mercedes Benz, KNPL is well-positioned to capitalize on future growth opportunities. Product Portfolio and Market Segmentation KNPLs product range is diverse, catering to a wide array of needs across both the decorative and industrial segments. The companys comprehensive product portfolio is designed to meet the varied demands of its clients, ranging from individual homeowners to large industrial entities. Decorative Segment : Interior and Exterior Paints : KNPL offers a wide range of paints for interior and exterior applications, including emulsions, enamels, and distempers. The companys interior range is known for its rich textures and vibrant colors, while the exterior range provides durability and protection against harsh weather conditions. Designer Range : This includes premium paints that cater to high-end interior decoration needs. These products are designed for customers seeking a unique look for their homes or commercial spaces. Enamel and Wood Finishes : Specialized coatings designed to provide a smooth, long-lasting finish for wood and metal surfaces. Written by Viveat Susan Pinto July 9, 2025 21:24 IST Follow Us Asian Paints Exits AkzoNobel India for Rs 734 Crore as JSW Paints Eyes Control. (Image Source: Reuters) Asian Paints , the countrys largest paint maker, on Wednesday, sold its entire 4.42% shareholding in AkzoNobel India for Rs 734 crore. The transaction comes close on the heels of rival JSW Paints announcing that it was acquiring a 74.76% stake in AkzoNobel India. The transaction was executed via a bulk deal at a floor price of Rs 3,651 per share, data from NSE shows. Shares of AkzoNobel India closed trade down 1.6% at Rs 3,627 apiece on Wednesday on the NSE. Two million shares exchanged hands in the bulk deal. Buyers included EastSpring Investments India and ICICI Prudential Mutual Fund, who bought 0.25 million and 0.7 million shares each, data from the stock exchange shows. ALSO READ US short-seller accuses Vedanta parent of running a ponzi scheme Asian Paints shares closed trade at Rs 2,497.30 apiece on Wednesday on the NSE, up 0.51% from the previous days close. The acquisition of a controlling stake in AkzoNobel India for Rs 8,986 crore will push JSW Paints to the fourth spot in the pecking order of paints companies. JSW Paints has said that it is keen to get into the third position in three years by expanding its manufacturing and distribution. ALSO READ Zepto set to raise $500 mn at 40% higher valuation Indias Rs 80,000-crore paint market is currently dominated by major players such as Asian Paints, Berger Paints , Kansai Nerolac and AkzoNobel India, with new entrants such as Birla Opus growing its share quickly in a year. Asian Paints has said that the competitive flux will remain in the sector for the next few years amid the fight to get bigger among players. in India, today at the Board meeting announced its audited results for the fourth quarter of the financial year 2024-25. For the quarter, the company declared Net revenue of Rs. 1740.4 Crores, a growth of 4.7 % over the corresponding quarter of the previous year. EBIDTA was at Rs. 177.8 Crores, a de-growth of 0.7 % over the same quarter of the previous year. PBT before exception items was at Rs 163.8 Crores, a growth of 1.0 % over the same quarter of the previous year. For the year, net revenue was Rs. 7496.7 Crores, growth of 1.4 % over the same period of the previous year. EBIDTA was at Rs. 974.1 Crores, a de-growth of 4.8% over the same period of the previous year. PBT before exceptional items were at Rs. 907.4 Crores, a de-growth of 1.7 % over the same period of the previous year. The Board has recommended a total dividend of 375 % ( 3.75 per share) including special dividend of 125% ( 1.25 per share) for the financial year ended March 31, 2025, as compared to total dividend of 375 % ( 3.75 per share) last year. Commenting on the results, Mr. Pravin Chaudhari, Managing Director, Kansai Nerolac Paints Ltd said, During the quarter, In Decorative, the growth of Paint+, Construction Chemicals, Wood finishes and Projects continued to do well. There is a gradual recovery seen in overall demand for Decorative as compared to the previous quarter, though the category continued to see tight liquidity and lower spending on discretionary items. The demand for Automotive continued to be better than the market, based on various initiatives. Performance Coatings also continued to register strong growth on the basis of a strong order pipeline. The various initiatives launched by the company over the past 3 years continue to yield results for the company. During the quarter, raw material cost was benign, however forex continued to be volatile. Going forward, the forecast of a good monsoon should augur well for paint industry. Outlook of Indian Paint Industry: The size of domestic paint industry is estimated at around Rs. 75000 crores as of March 2024. The good growth in infrastructure, core sector as well as automobile and real estate is likely to have a positive effect on the overall demand of paint for the industry in the long run. Policy About us Services Kansai Nerolac Paints Limited (KNPL): Detailed Analysis marketinsiders.in Oct 4, 2024 Oct 4, 2024 Kansai Nerolac Paints Limited (KNPL) has cemented its position as one of the leading players in the Indian paint industry. As a subsidiary of the Japan-based Kansai Paint Company Ltd., KNPL benefits from global expertise while catering to the diverse and rapidly growing Indian market. The company offers a wide range of products, serving both the decorative and industrial segments with equal proficiency. As of FY24, KNPL boasts an annual production capacity of 61 crore liters, with a strategic plan to scale up to approximately 70 crore liters by FY25. This growth trajectory is driven by the ongoing construction of a new manufacturing facility in Vishakhapatnam. Once completed, this unit will significantly boost the companys overall production capacity and help meet the rising demand across its various product categories. The companys distribution network is extensive, with a strong presence in tier-2, tier-3, and rural areas, which collectively contribute to a significant portion of its revenue. However, KNPL is also keenly focused on expanding its footprint in tier-1 cities, where it sees substantial growth potential. Currently, approximately 55% of the companys revenue is generated from the decorative segment, while the industrial segment contributes the remaining 45%. Within the industrial segment, the automotive industry is a key driver, accounting for over 70% of revenues. Over the years, KNPL has diversified its offerings to include adhesives, construction chemicals, and waterproofing membranes. This diversification is not limited to product lines; the company has also expanded geographically. Today, it operates subsidiaries in Sri Lanka, Nepal, and Bangladesh, enhancing its market position in South Asia. With a robust clientele that includes major automotive manufacturers like Maruti Suzuki, Toyota Kirloskar, Tata Motors, and Mercedes Benz, KNPL is well-positioned to capitalize on future growth opportunities. Product Portfolio and Market Segmentation KNPLs product range is diverse, catering to a wide array of needs across both the decorative and industrial segments. The companys comprehensive product portfolio is designed to meet the varied demands of its clients, ranging from individual homeowners to large industrial entities. Decorative Segment : Interior and Exterior Paints : KNPL offers a wide range of paints for interior and exterior applications, including emulsions, enamels, and distempers. The companys interior range is known for its rich textures and vibrant colors, while the exterior range provides durability and protection against harsh weather conditions. Designer Range : This includes premium paints that cater to high-end interior decoration needs. These products are designed for customers seeking a unique look for their homes or commercial spaces. Enamel and Wood Finishes : Specialized coatings designed to provide a smooth, long-lasting finish for wood and metal surfaces. Net profit for the quarter rose18% year-on-year to 263 crore as against 222.6 crore in the same quarter a year ago. The paint company\'s revenue from operations for the quarter stood at 2,704 crore, a 7% growth from last year\'s 2,520 crore. The company\'s EBITDA (Earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortisation) rose 22% to 427.7 crore for the quarter from 351 crore last year. This will be subject to approval of the shareholders at the 101st Annual General Meeting. Berger Paints Managing Director and CEO Abhijit Roy said the tough market conditions continued into the fourth quarter with muted urban demand and increased competition intensity. In spite of this, the company was able to deliver high single-digit volume growth, with sequential improvement in value performance with reduced gap between volume-value growth gap, supported by easing impact of Q4 FY24 price reductions and momentum in the premium emulsion category. On the international front, Berger Paints\' operations in Poland and Nepal saw good topline performances with the Nepal operations seeing a turnaround on the back of improved business conditions and a low base. "We remain optimistic about the demand scenario for the months ahead on the back of the favorable budget announcements, government spending on infrastructure & development and a good monsoon season." Business News Kansai Nerolac Paints Ltd Announces Q4 2024 Results FY 2024-20 Uploaded On May 7, 2025 by Team Konexio Mumbai : Kansai Nerolac Paints Limited (KNPL), one of the leading Paint companies in India, today at the Board meeting announced its audited results for the fourth quarter of the financial year 2024-25. For the quarter, the company declared Net revenue of Rs. 1740.4 Crores, a growth of 4.7 % over the corresponding quarter of the previous year. EBIDTA was at Rs. 177.8 Crores, a de-growth of 0.7 % over the same quarter of the previous year. PBT before exception items was at Rs 163.8 Crores, a growth of 1.0 % over the same quarter of the previous year. For the year, net revenue was Rs. 7496.7 Crores, growth of 1.4 % over the same period of the previous year. EBIDTA was at Rs. 974.1 Crores, a de-growth of 4.8% over the same period of the previous year. PBT before exceptional items were at Rs. 907.4 Crores, a de-growth of 1.7 % over the same period of the previous year. The Board has recommended a total dividend of 375 % ( 3.75 per share) including special dividend of 125% ( 1.25 per share) for the financial year ended March 31, 2025, as compared to total dividend of 375 % ( 3.75 per share) last year. Commenting on the results, Mr. Pravin Chaudhari, Managing Director, Kansai Nerolac Paints Ltd said, During the quarter, In Decorative, the growth of Paint+, Construction Chemicals, Wood finishes and Projects continued to do well. EBIDTA was at Rs. 177.8 Crores, a de-growth of 0.7 % over the same quarter of the previous year.
